context: The word 'elin' can refer to a physical organ of the body, or euphemistically to the penis. It can also mean a governmental or other authoritative body. The word is derived from the verb 'elää', meaning 'to live'.  It declines in various cases depending on its function in a sentence; for example, 'elimen' is the genitive singular form ('of an organ'), and 'elimet' is the nominative plural ('organs').
